page.title: 12TIMBER-FRAMED HOUSING
page.content: {Timber-framed housing}is made by first erecting a pre-fabricated wooden skeleton and then screwing on chipboard or plywood sheeting so that the shape of the house is created using the frame as an innerskin then building round it with bricks.Hard wood window frames are then put in place together with double-glazed windows. Recently the{attitude}of the public towards this type of house construction has adversely changed as there have been complaints about the wood frames rotting. Just lately buildings in the course of construction have been sheeted in polythene cladding to prevent this. Timber-framed housing conserves{energy as the gap between the wooden sheeting and brickwork is always filled with heat insulation material
